title: Start a new app experience (replace current family chat UI with a new-app placeholder)

requirements.text: Replace the current Family Chat app primary flow (chat + family settings views) with a minimal “New App” placeholder experience that clearly indicates this is a fresh app starting point, since the user requested creating a new app. The placeholder must be accessible after Internet Identity sign-in and should not expose the existing chat or family settings screens from the main navigation.
acceptanceCriteria: After signing in, the app shows a dedicated “New App” placeholder screen instead of the ChatPage/FamilySettingsPage views.
The AppShell navigation does not provide routes/tabs/buttons to the existing chat or family settings screens.
All user-facing text on the placeholder screen is in English.
The app still builds and runs with the existing React + React Query + Internet Identity setup (no edits required to immutable hook/provider files).

requirements.text: Add a simple “What do you want to build?” input area on the “New App” placeholder screen to capture the user’s intended new app description locally (client-side state only), with a prominent call-to-action to continue (no backend persistence required).
acceptanceCriteria: The placeholder screen includes a text input (multi-line) labeled in English (e.g., “Describe your app”).
Typing into the input updates local state and is preserved while the user stays on the page.
A primary button (English label) is present; clicking it shows an on-screen confirmation (e.g., inline alert) that the description was captured (no backend calls).

constraints: Do not modify files under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or any files under frontend/src/components/ui (immutable paths).
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only introduce migration.mo if a persistent state upgrade is necessary.
nonGoals: Do not implement any new backend data model or APIs for the new app idea capture.
Do not delete existing backend family chat logic; only remove/hide its UI entry points from the primary user flow.
Do not add third-party authentication providers (Internet Identity only).
